fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables OAuth access token validation by introspection to a third party.

fields.name: SigningMethod
fields.doc: SigningMethod to verify signing method used in jwt - allowed values HMAC/RSA/ECDSA.

fields.name: Source
fields.doc:
Source is the secret to verify signature, it could be one among:
- a base64 encoded static secret,
- a valid JWK url in plain text,
- a valid JWK url in base64 encoded format.

fields.name: IdentityBaseField
fields.doc: IdentityBaseField is the identity claim name.

fields.name: IssuedAtValidationSkew
fields.doc: IssuedAtValidationSkew is the clock skew to be considered while validating iat claim.

fields.name: NotBeforeValidationSkew
fields.doc: NotBeforeValidationSkew is the clock skew to be considered while validating nbf claim.

fields.name: ExpiresAtValidationSkew
fields.doc: ExpiresAtValidationSkew is the clock skew to be considered while validating exp claim.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables OAuth access token validation by introspection to a third party.

fields.name: URL
fields.doc: URL is the URL of the third party provider's introspection endpoint.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.doc: ClientID is the public identifier for the client, acquired from the third party.

fields.name: ClientSecret
fields.doc: ClientSecret is a secret known only to the client and the authorization server, acquired from the third party.

fields.name: IdentityBaseField
fields.doc: IdentityBaseField is the key showing where to find the user id in the claims. If it is empty, the `sub` key is looked at.

fields.name: Cache
fields.doc: Cache is the caching mechanism for introspection responses.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables the caching mechanism for introspection responses.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.doc:
Timeout is the duration in seconds of how long the cached value stays.
For introspection caching, it is suggested to use a short interval.

declarations.doc: APIDef is struct to hold both OAS and Classic forms of an API definition.
Allowance describes allowance actions and behaviour.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled is a boolean flag, if set to `true`, then individual allowances (allow, block, ignore) will be enforced.

fields.name: IgnoreCase
fields.doc: IgnoreCase is a boolean flag, If set to `true`, checks for requests allowance will be case insensitive.

declarations.doc: AllowanceType holds the valid allowance types values.
AuthSource defines an authentication source.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the auth source.
Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs[X].use_param/use_cookie`

fields.name: Name
fields.doc:
Name is the name of the auth source.
Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs[X].param_name/cookie_name`

declarations.doc:
AuthSources defines authentication source configuration: headers, cookies and query parameters.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs{}`.

fields.name: Header
fields.doc:
Header contains configurations for the header value auth source, it is enabled by default.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs[x].header`

fields.name: Cookie
fields.doc:
Cookie contains configurations for the cookie value auth source.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs[x].cookie`

fields.name: Query
fields.doc:
Query contains configurations for the query parameters auth source.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs[x].query`

declarations.doc: Authentication types contains configuration about the authentication methods and security policies applied to requests.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled makes the API protected when one of the authentication modes is enabled.

Tyk classic API definition: `!use_keyless`.

fields.name: StripAuthorizationData
fields.doc:
StripAuthorizationData ensures that any security tokens used for accessing APIs are stripped and not leaked to the upstream.

Tyk classic API definition: `strip_auth_data`.

fields.name: BaseIdentityProvider
fields.doc:
BaseIdentityProvider enables multi authentication mechanism and provides the session object that determines rate limits, ACL rules and quotas.
It should be set to one of the following:

- `auth_token`
- `hmac_key`
- `basic_auth_user`
- `jwt_claim`
- `oidc_user`
- `oauth_key`
- `custom_auth`

Tyk classic API definition: `base_identity_provided_by`.

fields.name: HMAC
fields.doc:
HMAC contains the configurations related to HMAC authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["hmac"]`

fields.name: OIDC
fields.doc:
OIDC contains the configurations related to OIDC authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["oidc"]`

fields.name: Custom
fields.doc:
Custom contains the configurations related to Custom authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["coprocess"]`

fields.name: SecuritySchemes
fields.doc: SecuritySchemes contains security schemes definitions.

declarations.doc: AuthenticationPlugin holds the configuration for custom authentication plugin.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables custom authentication plugin.

fields.name: FunctionName
fields.doc: FunctionName is the name of authentication method.

fields.name: Path
fields.doc: Path is the path to shared object file in case of gopluign mode or path to js code in case of otto auth plugin.

fields.name: RawBodyOnly
fields.doc: RawBodyOnly if set to true, do not fill body in request or response object.

fields.name: IDExtractor
fields.doc: IDExtractor configures ID extractor with coprocess custom authentication.

declarations.doc: Basic type holds configuration values related to http basic authentication.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the basic authentication mode.
Tyk classic API definition: `use_basic_auth`

fields.name: DisableCaching
fields.doc:
DisableCaching disables the caching of basic authentication key.
Tyk classic API definition: `basic_auth.disable_caching`

fields.name: CacheTTL
fields.doc:
CacheTTL is the TTL for a cached basic authentication key in seconds.
Tyk classic API definition: `basic_auth.cache_ttl`

fields.name: ExtractCredentialsFromBody
fields.doc:
ExtractCredentialsFromBody helps to extract username and password from body. In some cases, like dealing with SOAP,
user credentials can be passed via request body.

declarations.doc: CORS holds configuration for cross-origin resource sharing.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled is a boolean flag, if set to `true`, this option enables CORS processing.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.enable`.

fields.name: MaxAge
fields.doc:
MaxAge indicates how long (in seconds) the results of a preflight request can be cached. The default is 0 which stands for no max age.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.max_age`.

fields.name: AllowCredentials
fields.doc:
AllowCredentials indicates whether the request can include user credentials like cookies,
HTTP authentication or client side SSL certificates.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.allow_credentials`.

fields.name: ExposedHeaders
fields.doc:
ExposedHeaders indicates which headers are safe to expose to the API of a CORS API specification.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.exposed_headers`.

fields.name: AllowedHeaders
fields.doc:
AllowedHeaders holds a list of non simple headers the client is allowed to use with cross-domain requests.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.allowed_headers`.

fields.name: OptionsPassthrough
fields.doc:
OptionsPassthrough is a boolean flag. If set to `true`, it will proxy the CORS OPTIONS pre-flight
request directly to upstream, without authentication and any CORS checks. This means that pre-flight
requests generated by web-clients such as SwaggerUI or the Tyk Portal documentation system
will be able to test the API using trial keys.

If your service handles CORS natively, then enable this option.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.options_passthrough`.

fields.name: Debug
fields.doc:
Debug is a boolean flag, If set to `true`, this option produces log files for the CORS middleware.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.debug`.

fields.name: AllowedOrigins
fields.doc:
AllowedOrigins holds a list of origin domains to allow access from. Wildcards are also supported, e.g. `http://*.foo.com`

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.allowed_origins`.

fields.name: AllowedMethods
fields.doc:
AllowedMethods holds a list of methods to allow access via.

Tyk classic API definition: `CORS.allowed_methods`.

declarations.doc: Cache holds configuration for caching the requests.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled turns global cache middleware on or off. It is still possible to enable caching on a per-path basis
by explicitly setting the endpoint cache middleware.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.enable_cache`

fields.name: Timeout
fields.doc:
Timeout is the TTL for a cached object in seconds.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.cache_timeout`

fields.name: CacheAllSafeRequests
fields.doc:
CacheAllSafeRequests caches responses to (`GET`, `HEAD`, `OPTIONS`) requests overrides per-path cache settings in versions,
applies across versions.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.cache_all_safe_requests`

fields.name: CacheResponseCodes
fields.doc:
CacheResponseCodes is an array of response codes which are safe to cache e.g. `404`.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.cache_response_codes`

fields.name: CacheByHeaders
fields.doc:
CacheByHeaders allows header values to be used as part of the cache key.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.cache_by_headers`

fields.name: EnableUpstreamCacheControl
fields.doc:
EnableUpstreamCacheControl instructs Tyk Cache to respect upstream cache control headers.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.enable_upstream_cache_control`

fields.name: ControlTTLHeaderName
fields.doc:
ControlTTLHeaderName is the response header which tells Tyk how long it is safe to cache the response for.

Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options.cache_control_ttl_header`

declarations.doc: CachePlugin holds the configuration for the cache plugins.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled is a boolean flag. If set to `true`, the advanced caching plugin will be enabled.

fields.name: CacheByRegex
fields.doc:
CacheByRegex defines a regular expression used against the request body to produce a cache key.

Example value: `\"id\":[^,]*` (quoted json value).

fields.name: CacheResponseCodes
fields.doc: CacheResponseCodes contains a list of valid response codes for responses that are okay to add to the cache.

declarations.doc: CertificatePinning holds the configuration about mapping of domains to pinned public keys.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled is a boolean flag, if set to `true`, it enables certificate pinning for the API.

Tyk classic API definition: `certificate_pinning_disabled`

fields.name: DomainToPublicKeysMapping
fields.doc:
DomainToPublicKeysMapping maintains the mapping of domain to pinned public keys.

Tyk classic API definition: `pinned_public_keys`

declarations.doc: ClientCertificates holds a list of client certificates which are allowed to make requests against the server.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables static mTLS for the API.

fields.name: Allowlist
fields.doc: Allowlist is the list of client certificates which are allowed.

declarations.doc: ClientToPolicy contains a 1-1 mapping between Client ID and Policy ID.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.doc: ClientID contains a Client ID.

fields.name: PolicyID
fields.doc: PolicyID contains a Policy ID.

declarations.doc: CustomPlugin configures custom plugin.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables the custom pre plugin.

fields.name: FunctionName
fields.doc: FunctionName is the name of authentication method.

fields.name: Path
fields.doc: Path is the path to shared object file in case of gopluign mode or path to js code in case of otto auth plugin.

fields.name: RawBodyOnly
fields.doc: RawBodyOnly if set to true, do not fill body in request or response object.

fields.name: RequireSession
fields.doc:
RequireSession if set to true passes down the session information for plugins after authentication.
RequireSession is used only with JSVM custom middleware.

declarations.doc: CustomPluginAuthentication holds configuration for custom plugins.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the CustomPluginAuthentication authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `enable_coprocess_auth`/`use_go_plugin_auth`.

fields.name: Config
fields.doc:
Config contains configuration related to custom authentication plugin.
Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.auth_check`.

declarations.doc: CustomPlugins is a list of CustomPlugin.
Domain holds the configuration of the domain name the server should listen on.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled allow/disallow the usage of the domain.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name is the name of the domain.

declarations.doc: DomainToCertificate holds a single mapping of domain name into a certificate.

fields.name: Domain
fields.doc: Domain contains the domain name.

fields.name: Certificate
fields.doc: Certificate contains the certificate mapped to the domain.

declarations.doc: EndpointPostPlugin contains endpoint level post plugin configuration.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables post plugin.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name is the name of plugin function to be executed.

fields.name: Path
fields.doc: Path is the path to plugin.

declarations.doc: EnforceTimeout holds the configuration for enforcing request timeouts.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled is a boolean flag. If set to `true`, requests will enforce a configured timeout.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc: Value is the configured timeout in seconds.

declarations.doc: ExtractCredentialsFromBody configures extracting credentials from the request body.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables extracting credentials from body.
Tyk classic API definition: `basic_auth.extract_from_body`

fields.name: UserRegexp
fields.doc:
UserRegexp is the regex for username e.g. `<User>(.*)</User>`.
Tyk classic API definition: `basic_auth.userRegexp`

fields.name: PasswordRegexp
fields.doc:
PasswordRegexp is the regex for password e.g. `<Password>(.*)</Password>`.
Tyk classic API definition: `basic_auth.passwordRegexp`

declarations.doc: FieldDocError holds a list of errors.
FieldInfo holds details about a field.

fields.name: Doc
fields.doc: Doc is field docs. comments that are not part of docs are excluded.

fields.name: JSONName
fields.doc: JSONName is the corresponding json name of the field.

fields.name: JSONType
fields.doc: JSONType valid json type if it was found

fields.name: GoPath
fields.doc: GoPath is the go path of this field starting from root object

fields.name: MapKey
fields.doc: MapKey is the map key type, if this field is a map

fields.name: IsArray
fields.doc: IsArray reports if this field is an array.

declarations.doc: FromOASExamples configures mock responses should be returned from OAS example responses.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables getting a mock response from OAS examples or schemas documented in OAS.

fields.name: Code
fields.doc: Code is the default HTTP response code that the gateway reads from the path responses documented in OAS.

fields.name: ContentType
fields.doc: ContentType is the default HTTP response body type that the gateway reads from the path responses documented in OAS.

fields.name: ExampleName
fields.doc: ExampleName is the default example name among multiple path response examples documented in OAS.

declarations.doc: GatewayTags holds a list of segment tags that should apply for a gateway.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables use of segment tags.

fields.name: Tags
fields.doc: Tags is a list of segment tags

declarations.doc: Global holds configuration applies globally: CORS and caching.

fields.name: PluginConfig
fields.doc: PluginConfig contains the configuration related custom plugin bundles/driver.

fields.name: CORS
fields.doc:
CORS contains the configuration related to cross origin resource sharing.
Tyk classic API definition: `CORS`.

fields.name: PrePlugin
fields.doc:
PrePlugin contains configuration related to custom pre-authentication plugin.
Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.pre`.

fields.name: PostAuthenticationPlugin
fields.doc:
PostAuthenticationPlugin contains configuration related to custom post authentication plugin.
Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.post_key_auth`.

fields.name: PostPlugin
fields.doc:
PostPlugin contains configuration related to custom post plugin.
Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.post`.

fields.name: ResponsePlugin
fields.doc:
ResponsePlugin contains configuration related to custom post plugin.
Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.response`.

fields.name: Cache
fields.doc:
Cache contains the configurations related to caching.
Tyk classic API definition: `cache_options`.

declarations.doc: HMAC holds the configuration for the HMAC authentication mode.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the HMAC authentication mode.
Tyk classic API definition: `enable_signature_checking`

fields.name: AllowedAlgorithms
fields.doc:
AllowedAlgorithms is the array of HMAC algorithms which are allowed. Tyk supports the following HMAC algorithms:

- `hmac-sha1`
- `hmac-sha256`
- `hmac-sha384`
- `hmac-sha512`

and reads the value from algorithm header.

Tyk classic API definition: `hmac_allowed_algorithms`

fields.name: AllowedClockSkew
fields.doc:
AllowedClockSkew is the amount of milliseconds that will be tolerated for clock skew. It is used against replay attacks.
The default value is `0`, which deactivates clock skew checks.
Tyk classic API definition: `hmac_allowed_clock_skew`

declarations.doc: Header holds a header name and value pair.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name is the name of the header.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc: Value is the value of the header.

declarations.doc: IDExtractor configures ID Extractor.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables ID extractor with coprocess authentication.

fields.name: Source
fields.doc: Source is the source from which ID to be extracted from.

fields.name: With
fields.doc: With is the type of ID extractor to be used.

fields.name: Config
fields.doc: Config holds the configuration specific to ID extractor type mentioned via With.

declarations.doc: IDExtractorConfig specifies the configuration for ID extractor.

fields.name: HeaderName
fields.doc: HeaderName is the header name to extract ID from.

fields.name: FormParamName
fields.doc: FormParamName is the form parameter name to extract ID from.

fields.name: Regexp
fields.doc: Regexp is the regular expression to match ID.

fields.name: RegexpMatchIndex
fields.doc:
RegexpMatchIndex is the index from which ID to be extracted after a match.
Default value is 0, ie if regexpMatchIndex is not provided ID is matched from index 0.

fields.name: XPathExp
fields.doc: XPathExp is the xpath expression to match ID.

declarations.doc: Info contains the main metadata about the API definition.

fields.name: ID
fields.doc:
ID is the unique ID of the API.
Tyk classic API definition: `api_id`

fields.name: DBID
fields.doc:
DBID is the unique database ID of the API.
Tyk classic API definition: `id`

fields.name: OrgID
fields.doc:
OrgID is the ID of the organisation which the API belongs to.
Tyk classic API definition: `org_id`

fields.name: Name
fields.doc:
Name is the name of the API.
Tyk classic API definition: `name`

fields.name: Expiration
fields.doc: Expiration date.

fields.name: State
fields.doc: State holds configuration about API definition states (active, internal).

fields.name: Versioning
fields.doc: Versioning holds configuration for API versioning.

declarations.doc: JWT holds the configuration for the JWT middleware.
ListenPath represents the path the server should listen on.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc:
Value is the value of the listen path e.g. `/api/` or `/` or `/httpbin/`.
Tyk classic API definition: `proxy.listen_path`

fields.name: Strip
fields.doc:
Strip removes the inbound listen path in the outgoing request. e.g. `http://acme.com/httpbin/get` where `httpbin`
is the listen path. The `httpbin` listen path which is used to identify the API loaded in Tyk is removed,
and the outbound request would be `http://httpbin.org/get`.
Tyk classic API definition: `proxy.strip_listen_path`

declarations.doc: Middleware holds configuration for middleware.

fields.name: Global
fields.doc: Global contains the configurations related to the global middleware.

fields.name: Operations
fields.doc: Operations configuration.

declarations.doc: MockResponse configures the mock responses.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables the mock response middleware.

fields.name: Code
fields.doc: Code is the HTTP response code that will be returned.

fields.name: Body
fields.doc: Body is the HTTP response body that will be returned.

fields.name: Headers
fields.doc: Headers are the HTTP response headers that will be returned.

fields.name: FromOASExamples
fields.doc: FromOASExamples is the configuration to extract a mock response from OAS documentation.

declarations.doc: MutualTLS holds configuration related to mTLS on APIs, domain to certificate mappings.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables/disables upstream mutual TLS auth for the API.
Tyk classic API definition: `upstream_certificates_disabled`

fields.name: DomainToCertificates
fields.doc:
DomainToCertificates maintains the mapping of domain to certificate.
Tyk classic API definition: `upstream_certificates`

declarations.doc: Notifications holds configuration for updates to keys.

fields.name: SharedSecret
fields.doc: SharedSecret is the shared secret used in the notification request.

fields.name: OnKeyChangeURL
fields.doc: OnKeyChangeURL is the URL a request will be triggered against.

declarations.doc: OAS holds the upstream OAS definition as well as adds functionality like custom JSON marshalling.
OAuth configures the OAuth middleware.
OIDC contains configuration for the OIDC authentication mode.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the OIDC authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `use_openid`

fields.name: SegregateByClientId
fields.doc:
SegregateByClientId is a boolean flag. If set to `true, the policies will be applied to a combination of Client ID and User ID.

Tyk classic API definition: `openid_options.segregate_by_client`.

fields.name: Providers
fields.doc:
Providers contains a list of authorised providers and their Client IDs, and matched policies.

Tyk classic API definition: `openid_options.providers`.

fields.name: Scopes
fields.doc: Scopes contains the defined scope claims.

declarations.doc: Operation holds a request operation configuration, allowances, tranformations, caching, timeouts and validation.

fields.name: Allow
fields.doc: Allow request by allowance.

fields.name: Block
fields.doc: Block request by allowance.

fields.name: IgnoreAuthentication
fields.doc: IgnoreAuthentication ignores authentication on request by allowance.

fields.name: TransformRequestMethod
fields.doc: TransformRequestMethod allows you to transform the method of a request.

fields.name: TransformRequestBody
fields.doc:
TransformRequestBody allows you to transform request body.
When both `path` and `body` are provided, body would take precedence.

fields.name: Cache
fields.doc: Cache contains the caching plugin configuration.

fields.name: EnforceTimeout
fields.doc: EnforceTimeout contains the request timeout configuration.

fields.name: ValidateRequest
fields.doc: ValidateRequest contains the request validation configuration.

fields.name: MockResponse
fields.doc: MockResponse contains the mock response configuration.

fields.name: VirtualEndpoint
fields.doc: VirtualEndpoint contains virtual endpoint configuration.

fields.name: PostPlugins
fields.doc: PostPlugins contains endpoint level post plugins configuration.

declarations.doc: Operations holds Operation definitions.
Path holds plugin configurations for HTTP method verbs.
Paths is a mapping of API endpoints to Path plugin configurations.
PinnedPublicKey contains a mapping from the domain name into a list of public keys.

fields.name: Domain
fields.doc: Domain contains the domain name.

fields.name: PublicKeys
fields.doc: PublicKeys contains a list of the public keys pinned to the domain name.

declarations.doc: PinnedPublicKeys is a list of domains and pinned public keys for them.
PluginBundle holds configuration for custom plugins.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the custom plugin bundles.

Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware_bundle_disabled`

fields.name: Path
fields.doc:
Path is the path suffix to construct the URL to fetch plugin bundle from.
Path will be suffixed to `bundle_base_url` in gateway config.

declarations.doc: PluginConfig holds configuration for custom plugins.

fields.name: Driver
fields.doc:
Driver configures which custom plugin to be used.
It's value should be set to one of the following:

- `otto`,
- `python`,
- `lua`,
- `grpc`,
- `goplugin`.

Tyk classic API definition: `custom_middleware.driver`.

fields.name: Bundle
fields.doc: Bundle configures custom plugin bundles.

fields.name: Data
fields.doc: Data configures custom plugin data.

declarations.doc: PluginConfigData configures config data for custom plugins.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables custom plugin config data.

fields.name: Value
fields.doc: Value is the value of custom plugin config data.

declarations.doc: Plugins configures common settings for each plugin, allowances, transforms, caching and timeouts.

fields.name: Allow
fields.doc: Allow request by allowance.

fields.name: Block
fields.doc: Block request by allowance.

fields.name: IgnoreAuthentication
fields.doc: Ignore authentication on request by allowance.

fields.name: TransformRequestMethod
fields.doc: TransformRequestMethod allows you to transform the method of a request.

fields.name: Cache
fields.doc: Cache allows you to cache the server side response.

fields.name: EnforceTimeout
fields.doc: EnforceTimeout allows you to configure a request timeout.

declarations.doc: PostAuthenticationPlugin configures post authentication plugins.

fields.name: Plugins
fields.doc:
Plugins configures custom plugins to be run on pre authentication stage.
The plugins would be executed in the order of configuration in the list.

declarations.doc: PostPlugin configures post plugins.

fields.name: Plugins
fields.doc:
Plugins configures custom plugins to be run on post stage.
The plugins would be executed in the order of configuration in the list.

declarations.doc: PrePlugin configures pre stage plugins.

fields.name: Plugins
fields.doc:
Plugins configures custom plugins to be run on pre authentication stage.
The plugins would be executed in the order of configuration in the list.

declarations.doc: Provider defines an issuer to validate and the Client ID to Policy ID mappings.

fields.name: Issuer
fields.doc: Issuer contains a validation value for the issuer claim, usually a domain name e.g. `accounts.google.com` or similar.

fields.name: ClientToPolicyMapping
fields.doc: ClientToPolicyMapping contains mappings of Client IDs to Policy IDs.

declarations.doc: ResponsePlugin configures response plugins.

fields.name: Plugins
fields.doc:
Plugins configures custom plugins to be run on post stage.
The plugins would be executed in the order of configuration in the list.

declarations.doc: ScopeToPolicy contains a single scope to policy ID mapping.

fields.name: Scope
fields.doc: Scope contains the scope name.

fields.name: PolicyID
fields.doc: PolicyID contains the Policy ID.

declarations.doc: Scopes holds the scope to policy mappings for a claim name.

fields.name: ClaimName
fields.doc: ClaimName contains the claim name.

fields.name: ScopeToPolicyMapping
fields.doc: ScopeToPolicyMapping contains the mappings of scopes to policy IDs.

declarations.doc: SecurityScheme defines an Importer interface for security schemes.
SecuritySchemes holds security scheme values, filled with Import().
Server contains the configuration related to the OAS API definition.

fields.name: ListenPath
fields.doc:
ListenPath represents the path to listen on. Any requests coming into the host, on the port that Tyk is configured to run on,
that match this path will have the rules defined in the API definition applied.

fields.name: Slug
fields.doc:
Slug is the Tyk Cloud equivalent of listen path.
Tyk classic API definition: `slug`

fields.name: Authentication
fields.doc: Authentication contains the configurations related to authentication to the API.

fields.name: ClientCertificates
fields.doc: ClientCertificates contains the configurations related to static mTLS.

fields.name: GatewayTags
fields.doc: GatewayTags contains segment tags to configure which GWs your APIs connect to.

fields.name: CustomDomain
fields.doc:
CustomDomain is the domain to bind this API to.

Tyk classic API definition: `domain`

declarations.doc: ServiceDiscovery holds configuration required for service discovery.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables Service Discovery.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.use_discovery_service`

fields.name: QueryEndpoint
fields.doc:
QueryEndpoint is the endpoint to call, this would usually be Consul, etcd or Eureka K/V store.
Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.query_endpoint`

fields.name: DataPath
fields.doc:
DataPath is the namespace of the data path - where exactly in your service response the namespace can be found.
For example, if your service responds with:

```
{
 "action": "get",
 "node": {
   "key": "/services/single",
   "value": "http://httpbin.org:6000",
   "modifiedIndex": 6,
   "createdIndex": 6
 }
}
```

then your namespace would be `node.value`.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.data_path`

fields.name: UseNestedQuery
fields.doc:
UseNestedQuery enables using a combination of `dataPath` and `parentDataPath`.
It is necessary when the data lives within this string-encoded JSON object.

```
{
 "action": "get",
 "node": {
   "key": "/services/single",
   "value": "{"hostname": "http://httpbin.org", "port": "80"}",
   "modifiedIndex": 6,
   "createdIndex": 6
 }
}
```

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.use_nested_query`

fields.name: ParentDataPath
fields.doc:
ParentDataPath is the namespace of the where to find the nested
value, if `useNestedQuery` is `true`. In the above example, it
would be `node.value`. You would change the `dataPath` setting
to be `hostname`, since this is where the host name data
resides in the JSON string. Tyk automatically assumes that
`dataPath` in this case is in a string-encoded JSON object and
will try to deserialize it.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.parent_data_path`

fields.name: PortDataPath
fields.doc:
PortDataPath is the port of the data path. In the above nested example, we can see that there is a separate `port` value
for the service in the nested JSON. In this case, you can set the `portDataPath` value and Tyk will treat `dataPath` as
the hostname and zip them together (this assumes that the hostname element does not end in a slash or resource identifier
such as `/widgets/`). In the above example, the `portDataPath` would be `port`.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.port_data_path`

fields.name: UseTargetList
fields.doc:
UseTargetList should be set to `true`, if you are using load balancing. Tyk will treat the data path as a list and
inject it into the target list of your API definition.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.use_target_list`

fields.name: CacheTimeout
fields.doc:
CacheTimeout is the timeout of a cache value when a new data is loaded from a discovery service.
Setting it too low will cause Tyk to call the SD service too often, setting it too high could mean that
failures are not recovered from quickly enough.

Deprecated: The field is deprecated, usage needs to be updated to configure caching.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.cache_timeout`

fields.name: Cache
fields.doc:
Cache holds cache related flags.

Tyk classic API definition:
- `service_discovery.cache_disabled`
- `service_discovery.cache_timeout`

fields.name: TargetPath
fields.doc:
TargetPath is to set a target path to append to the discovered endpoint, since many SD services
only provide host and port data. It is important to be able to target a specific resource on that host.
Setting this value will enable that.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.target_path`

fields.name: EndpointReturnsList
fields.doc:
EndpointReturnsList is set `true` when the response type is a list instead of an object.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.endpoint_returns_list`

declarations.doc: ServiceDiscoveryCache holds configuration for caching ServiceDiscovery data.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled turns service discovery cache on or off.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.cache_disabled`

fields.name: Timeout
fields.doc:
Timeout is the TTL for a cached object in seconds.

Tyk classic API definition: `service_discovery.cache_timeout`

declarations.doc: Signature holds the configuration for signature validation.
State holds configuration about API definition states (active, internal).

fields.name: Active
fields.doc:
Active enables the API.
Tyk classic API definition: `active`

fields.name: Internal
fields.doc:
Internal makes the API accessible only internally.
Tyk classic API definition: `internal`

declarations.doc: StructInfo holds ast field information for the docs generator.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name is struct go name.

fields.name: Fields
fields.doc: Fields holds information of the fields, if this object is a struct.

declarations.doc: Test holds the test configuration for service discovery.

fields.name: ServiceDiscovery
fields.doc:
ServiceDiscovery contains the configuration related to test Service Discovery.
Tyk classic API definition: `proxy.service_discovery`

declarations.doc: Token holds the values related to authentication tokens.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc:
Enabled enables the token based authentication mode.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["authToken"].use_standard_auth`

fields.name: EnableClientCertificate
fields.doc:
EnableClientCertificate allows to create dynamic keys based on certificates.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["authToken"].use_certificate`

fields.name: Signature
fields.doc:
Signature holds the configuration for verifying the signature of the token.

Tyk classic API definition: `auth_configs["authToken"].use_certificate`

declarations.doc: TransformRequestBody holds configuration about body request transformations.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables transform request body middleware.

fields.name: Format
fields.doc: Format of the request body, xml or json.

fields.name: Path
fields.doc: Path file path for the template.

fields.name: Body
fields.doc: Body base64 encoded representation of the template.

declarations.doc: TransformRequestMethod holds configuration for rewriting request methods.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables Method Transform for the given path and method.

fields.name: ToMethod
fields.doc: ToMethod is the http method value to which the method of an incoming request will be transformed.

declarations.doc: TykExtensionConfigParams holds the essential configuration required for the Tyk Extension schema.
Upstream holds configuration for an upstream server.

fields.name: URL
fields.doc:
URL defines the target URL that the request should be proxied to.
Tyk classic API definition: `proxy.target_url`

fields.name: ServiceDiscovery
fields.doc:
ServiceDiscovery contains the configuration related to Service Discovery.
Tyk classic API definition: `proxy.service_discovery`

fields.name: Test
fields.doc: Test contains the configuration related to uptime tests.

fields.name: MutualTLS
fields.doc: MutualTLS contains the configuration related to upstream mutual TLS.

fields.name: CertificatePinning
fields.doc: CertificatePinning contains the configuration related to certificate pinning.

declarations.doc: ValidateRequest holds configuration required for validating requests.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled is a boolean flag, if set to `true`, it enables request validation.

fields.name: ErrorResponseCode
fields.doc:
ErrorResponseCode is the error code emitted when the request fails validation.
If unset or zero, the response will returned with http status 422 Unprocessable Entity.

declarations.doc: VersionToID contains a single mapping from a version name into an API ID.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name contains the user chosen version name, e.g. `v1` or similar.

fields.name: ID
fields.doc: ID is the API ID for the version set in Name.

declarations.doc:
Versioning holds configuration for API versioning.

Tyk classic API definition: `version_data`.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled is a boolean flag, if set to `true` it will enable versioning of an API.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name contains the name of the version as entered by the user ("v1" or similar).

fields.name: Default
fields.doc: Default contains the default version name if a request is issued without a version.

fields.name: Location
fields.doc:
Location contains versioning location information. It can be one of the following:

- `header`,
- `url-param`,
- `url`.

fields.name: Key
fields.doc: Key contains the name of the key to check for versioning information.

fields.name: Versions
fields.doc: Versions contains a list of versions that map to individual API IDs.

fields.name: StripVersioningData
fields.doc: StripVersioningData is a boolean flag, if set to `true`, the API responses will be stripped of versioning data.

declarations.doc: VirtualEndpoint contains virtual endpoint configuration.

fields.name: Enabled
fields.doc: Enabled enables virtual endpoint.

fields.name: Name
fields.doc: Name is the name of js function.

fields.name: Path
fields.doc: Path is the path to js file.

fields.name: Body
fields.doc: Body is the js function to execute encoded in base64 format.

fields.name: ProxyOnError
fields.doc: ProxyOnError proxies if virtual endpoint errors out.

fields.name: RequireSession
fields.doc: RequireSession if enabled passes session to virtual endpoint.

declarations.doc: XTykAPIGateway contains custom Tyk API extensions for the OAS definition.

fields.name: Info
fields.doc: Info contains the main metadata about the API definition.

fields.name: Upstream
fields.doc: Upstream contains the configurations related to the upstream.

fields.name: Server
fields.doc: Server contains the configurations related to the server.

fields.name: Middleware
fields.doc: Middleware contains the configurations related to the proxy middleware.

declarations.doc:
XTykDoc is a list of information for exported struct type info,
starting from the root struct declaration(XTykGateway).
